taxonomicnotes: Several distinct populations are known so it appears to be a species complex. The geographic limits of populations is not well known. A taxonomic revision for the complex is needed.
rationale: Although the taxonomy of various populations needs to be examined, and although threats from overfishing are apparent there was no evidence of widespread population decline. The species is widespread and abundant in suitable habitats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for east and southern Africa.
assessor: Bills, R., Kazembe, J. & Marshall, B.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
